item.title: Daily Blogroll: 2025-11-06
item.description:
Stargrace recounts Broseidon's bold and disastrous planning move in EVE Online, sparking chaos and strategic drama.

Syp explores LOTRO's Mirkwood, battling costume-clad goblins and mysterious vampires in a gloomy questing atmosphere.

SAFCO's thrilling escape from bioelectric bugs mixes sci-fi strategy and action in the jungles of Uetonah.

Joar finds a new 'employer' in his wife post-job loss, juggling gaming commitments with household duties.

Shintar navigates the highs and lows of Legion Remix in WoW, questioning the motivations and impact of game updates.

Tipa considers trading in board game setup hassles for the convenience of digital adventures with DarkQuest 4.

Cliffski navigates the ups and downs of solar farm maintenance, emphasizing the balance between cost and care.

Bhagpuss reflects on the unexpected reduction of gaming time, shifting priorities, and the unique joys of a slower pace in semi-retirement.

Dave Winer dives into the latest tech updates and political commentary while underscoring his disapproval of pundits ignoring voter sentiments.

Pete is amazed by Google's space data center project, marking a thrilling intersection of AI demands and space industry ambitions.

Remy Porter highlights the chaos of incomplete documentation masquerading as a roadmap, leaving developers baffled in WTF territory.

Crimson shares delightful DIY Halloween makeup mishaps and successes, embracing festive creativity over perfect execution.

item.title: Daily Blogroll: 2025-11-07
item.description:
Stargrace details a chaotic but thrilling escape in EVE Online, where fleet dynamics and improvised tactics steal the show.

Aywren explores 'Tiny Aquarium,' an idle game with social touches and a fish-collecting twist that keeps her coming back.

Bhagpuss takes a nostalgic dive into gaming procrastination with a final nod to 'Lake' and its surprising journey from wishlist to play-through.

Kimimi revisits 'Ghostbusters' and uncovers the magic that makes this game a love letter to fans, movie magic intact.

Belghast recounts a sleep-deprived day of catnaps and 'Path of Exile' progress, tackling maps and eyeing voidstones.

Wilhelm shares the slow burn of fleet life in EVE Online as The Imperium locks down a Keepstar with strategic entosis operations.

Tipa strategizes through clan wars with clever attrition tactics, learning from past battles to manage resources effectively.

Emily vents her intense dislike for Christian Grey, critiquing the disturbing portrayal of abuse masked as romance.

Dave Winer reflects on a whirlwind trip to NYC and a heart-to-heart chat with tech giants that rekindled some visionary spark.

Scopique juggles his streaming setup and discovers the practicality of using a phone for OBS, despite a lack of cable management finesse.

Remy Porter highlights a security blunder where short, simple passwords win over complex, secure ones, with hilarious bureaucracy twists.

CrazyKinux envisions a grounded 'Star Wars' prequel rewrite, melding 'Rogue One' grit with deep thematic explorations.
